modules.description: This module handles JWT token creation, validation, and lifecycle management with support for expiration, signature verification, and activation state tracking. It stores and retrieves key-value data within tokens, allowing optional secret overrides and forced reads. Use cases include authentication tokens with time-limited access, token-based user sessions, and secure data exchange with revocation capabilities.

This module handles JWT token creation, validation, and lifecycle management with PostgreSQL storage. It supports operations like creating signed tokens with expiration, reading and verifying token data, deactivating or reactivating tokens, and checking token status. Use cases include managing authentication tokens, password reset tokens, or API access tokens in a web application backed by PostgreSQL.

This module handles JWT token creation, validation, and lifecycle management using in-memory storage. It supports operations like signing tokens with optional secrets, reading and verifying claims, checking expiration and activity status, and deactivating or reactivating tokens. Concrete use cases include managing authentication tokens with expiration and revocation, and securely storing session data in stateless applications.

This module implements token management operations backed by PostgreSQL, including creating signed tokens with expiration, reading and verifying token data, deactivating or reactivating tokens, and checking token status. It works with string-based key-value pairs stored in a token, along with optional secrets and context metadata. Concrete use cases include handling authentication tokens, password reset tokens, and session management in web applications.

This module implements token management operations including creation, validation, and lifecycle control using a MariaDB backend. It handles string-based key-value data stored in tokens, supporting functions like signing, reading, verifying, and deactivating tokens. Concrete use cases include managing authentication tokens with expiration and signature checks, and maintaining token state in a distributed system.

This module provides implementations for token creation, validation, and lifecycle management using various storage backends such as MariaDB, PostgreSQL, and in-memory storage. It operates on string-based key-value data embedded in tokens, supporting operations like signing, expiration checks, revocation, and status verification. Use cases include handling authentication tokens, password reset flows, and session management in web applications with different persistence requirements.
